Detailed instructions / steps: Document test URL, API base, environment name, and any feature flags you’ll use. Verify you can reach the site and API health endpoints.
Confirm test payment provider is in test mode with known test cards, and that webhooks point to this environment. Confirm you can see outgoing emails (catch-all inbox or email preview).
Decide and write down emails for: platform admin (if used), future studio owner(s), and customers. Ensure they’re not used in production.
From the main login/signup page, create a new user with email/password. Verify success and auto-login if expected.
Trigger verification via email link. Test a fresh link (works), a reused link (shows already verified), and an expired/invalid link (friendly error).
Log out, then log in with valid credentials (success). Try an incorrect password (proper error). Log out again and confirm protected pages redirect to login.
Enable remember me if present, close and reopen browser, confirm still logged in. Let session expire and confirm expired session redirects to login without exposing data.
From public/marketing entry point, sign up as a new studio owner. Fill in studio name, email, and required fields. Confirm studio is created and you land in the studio context.
Try creating studios with duplicate slug, invalid characters, very long names, and reserved words. Confirm validation messages and no broken state.
Complete studio onboarding wizard (profile, address, time zone, branding). Refresh and confirm values persist and UI reflects branding.
Choose a studio subscription plan, complete checkout with a test card, and confirm subscription is active with correct plan and billing details.
As studio owner, create a staff member or instructor and send an invite. Follow the invite link, set password, and log in as staff.
As staff, verify you can see only allowed areas and cannot access billing, tenant admin, or cross-tenant data.
Create at least one location and any resources (rooms or equipment). Confirm they appear as options when creating classes.
Create multiple class types and schedule recurring classes with realistic times. Confirm schedule shows them at correct local times.
Create at least one recurring membership and one class pack or pass. Confirm they appear on admin and public views.
As a guest, browse the studio public schedule and use filters (instructor, time, level). Confirm only this studio’s classes are visible and filters behave correctly.
View the studio membership/pricing page. Confirm plan names, prices, and descriptions match configuration.
From the studio public site, sign up as a new customer. Confirm account is scoped to this studio (branding, URLs).
As the new customer, purchase a membership plan with a test card. Confirm success page, membership active in profile, and correct next billing date.
After purchase, verify card is stored and masked in account. Remove it and confirm removal works and later flows behave correctly.
With an active membership, book a class. Confirm booking appears in My Schedule and capacity is updated.
Assign or purchase a class pack and book a class. Confirm remaining visits decrement correctly.
Book a class requiring payment at booking, complete checkout, and confirm booking, payment record, and confirmation email.
Cancel a booking before cutoff. Confirm membership visits or passes are restored per policy.
Cancel after cutoff or mark no-show. Confirm penalties or forfeits apply correctly.
As staff, open today’s classes, check in a member, and confirm attendance status updates and persists.
As studio owner, upgrade from a lower plan to a higher plan. Confirm billing and feature unlocks behave as expected.
Downgrade from higher to lower plan. Confirm downgrade timing and feature changes are correct.
Cancel the studio subscription or let trial expire. Confirm public site changes appropriately and owner access is limited as designed.
On a public studio page, open chat as a guest. Confirm WebSocket connects, you can send a message, and staff can respond.
While chat is open, briefly disable network or restart API/Worker. Confirm client retries with backoff and reconnects without log spam.
As a logged-in member, use chat. Confirm you see the correct room and history and that messages persist on reload.
Verify booking confirmation, cancellation, and reminder emails have correct content and timing, and that unsubscribe/preferences are respected.
As platform admin, open the tenant list. Verify search and filters work and you see each tenant’s status without leaking sensitive data.
Open a studio’s detail page. Confirm information is correct and only appropriate details are visible (no secrets or full card data).
Use impersonation if available to enter a tenant’s view. Confirm it’s clearly indicated, actions are audited, and you can return to your own account.
Edit a global setting such as pricing template or feature flag and confirm it applies to the intended tenants only.
Log in as studio owner. Verify access to studio profile, branding, locations, staff, memberships, content, and billing.
Invite a staff member, change their role, and remove them. Confirm invitations work and removal immediately revokes access.
While logged in as studio owner A, attempt to navigate via URL to tenant B’s pages. Confirm access is blocked or redirected.
Using dev tools or API client, call endpoints with another tenant’s ID or slug. Confirm responses are denied or correctly scoped.
Log in as staff or instructor. Confirm navigation is limited to allowed areas such as schedule and rosters.
As staff, open today’s classes, view participants, and mark check-in or no-show if allowed. Confirm actions persist.
Attempt to access billing, studio global settings, or manage owner/admin roles. Confirm access is denied or links are hidden.
Log in as a member. Confirm you can see and edit only your own profile, memberships, and bookings.
Manually enter URLs for admin or staff pages as a member. Confirm redirect to login, 403, or safe page.
Attempt to access another member’s booking or profile via guessed URL or IDs. Confirm data is not exposed.
In an incognito window, browse public studio pages (home, schedule, pricing). Confirm content is visible and accurate.
Attempt to access member-only or admin URLs as a guest. Confirm redirect to login or safe error page.
As a guest, use chat on a studio page. Confirm basic messaging works without exposing internal data or other tenants.
On signup form, try invalid emails, weak passwords if rules exist, and duplicate emails. Confirm clear validation and no partial accounts.
Repeatedly attempt login with wrong password until you expect rate limiting or lockout. Confirm UI and API responses behave as designed.
Expire a session (or wait) then use the app. Confirm protected APIs return 401 and UI redirects to login without exposing data.
If using JWTs, manipulate a token and call an endpoint. Confirm the request is rejected and no data is returned.
While logged into Studio A, change URL to reference Studio B’s slug or ID. Confirm you cannot access Studio B’s data.
With a membership in Studio A, attempt to book a class in Studio B via UI or API. Confirm it is blocked or errors clearly.
Run exports or reports and confirm they include only data from the current tenant.
At checkout, use a test card configured to decline. Confirm clear error message and no active membership created.
Simulate a failed renewal via failing test card or config. Confirm membership state becomes grace or suspended and user messaging is correct.
After failed renewal, update card to a valid one and trigger retry. Confirm renewal succeeds and membership returns to active.
Change a member’s plan mid-cycle. Confirm no double-charge, correct proration if applicable, and correct next billing date.
Issue a partial or full refund. Confirm it appears in payment history and membership status behaves per rules.
Create classes around a DST change and verify times in admin and public views are correct and consistent.
Book a class to full capacity then attempt another booking. Confirm system blocks or waitlists as configured.
Attempt near-simultaneous bookings for the last spot using two browsers. Confirm final capacity is correct and no oversell.
Cancel just before and just after the cutoff time. Confirm each is treated correctly (refund vs late-cancel).
While chat widget is present, stop API/Worker or point to a bad endpoint. Confirm UI shows subtle connecting/error state, retries with backoff, and no log spam.
With active chat, toggle network offline/online. Confirm client disconnects and reconnects gracefully without losing messages.
Try to access or chat in a room for a different tenant or user. Confirm access is denied and other-tenant messages are not visible.
On desktop and mobile, complete signup, login, membership purchase, booking, and cancel flows. Confirm no critical layout or interaction issues.
Run main booking and purchase flows on Chrome, Safari, and Firefox. Confirm no browser-specific failures.
Using keyboard only, complete signup and booking. Confirm focus states are visible and all critical elements are reachable.
Intentionally trigger form errors across the app. Confirm error messages are clear, near fields, and readable by assistive tech where applicable.
